definition[0]: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
definition[1]: someone who is in charge of a horse race, meeting, or other public event
definition[2]: someone who protects something or is responsible for it, especially something such as nature, public property, or money
example[1]: Kissinger was now chief steward of US foreign policy.
definition[3]: a man whose job is to manage a large property, such as a farm
definition[4]: a man who serves food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
definition[5]: a worker who is elected by members of a TRADE UNION in a factory or other business to represent them when dealing with managers
example[2]: A meeting of shop stewards approved the strike action.
